name: Thanksgiving Leftovers: Sichuan-Style Hot and Numbing Sliced Turkey
description: If you've already eaten all the turkey leftovers, this dish can be made with sliced pork or chicken too. Throw the meat into a saucepan with chile oil (very simple to whip up from scratch), cilantro, Sichuan peppercorns, vinegar, and some roasted peanuts.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup hot chile oil, preferably homemade (see note)
1 tablespoon toasted ground Sichuan peppercorns, picked over for twigs or black seeds
1/2 pound to 1 pound roasted turkey breast, cold, sliced int 1/4-inch slices
1/2 cup roasted peanuts, crushed underneath heavy skillet

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chile oil, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, chile flakes, and half of peppercorns in a small bowl and mix with fork to combine. Combine turkey, cilantro, peanuts, and chile vinaigrette in small bowl and toss to combine. Pile onto plates and top with grated garlic and remaining Sichuan peppercorn.
